name: Events in Gozo
author: Ministry for Gozo and Planning

sections.description:
EventsInGozo.com aims to serve as a centralized hub for all events taking place on the island of Gozo. Organizers will create and submit their events, ensuring that each listing includes essential details for interested visitors, such as a concise description, dates, times, location, category, and accompanying pictures.

The plugin can then be installed in a third-party WordPress website and this retrieves specific events which are tailored for that particular website. Data is retrieved securely through the use of authentication. These authentication details must be requested from https://eventsingozo.com/request-api-plugin/ and once the application is accepted, the corresponding details are provided which must be set up in the plugin’s settings.

Source Code for Compressed Content

Compiled File | Source File

  1. events-in-gozo\assets\css\bootstrap-grid.min.css | events-in-gozo\assets\css\bootstrap-grid.css
  2. events-in-gozo\assets\js\flickity.pkgd.min.js | events-in-gozo\assets\js\flickity.pkgd.js

Third Party Services

We use the Events Calendar REST API (https://eventsingozo.com/wp-json/tribe/events/v1/events) which allows us to consume and manage events created with The Events Calendar from anywhere. For more information, here is a link explaining the service: https://theeventscalendar.com/knowledgebase/introduction-to-the-events-calendar-rest-api/. The privacy policy of the Events Calendar can be found here: https://theeventscalendar.com/privacy-policy/.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the entire events-in-gozo folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory.
  2. Activate the plugin through the \’Plugins\’ menu in WordPress.
  3. Configure the plugin settings through the \’Events in Gozo\’ menu in WordPress.

Installation through WordPress control panel:

  1. Login to your WordPress account using the administrators username and password.
  2. Click the plugins icon on the left menu.
  3. Click the \”Add New\” button at the top of the Plugins menu.
  4. Search for \”Events in Gozo\”
  5. Click on \”Install\”
  6. When the \”Plugin installed successfully\” message appears, click the \”Activate Plugin\” link.
  7. Click on \”Events in Gozo\” in the left menu.
  8. In the \”Settings\” tab, enter the username and password provided to you by the Events in Gozo team
  9. Paste the shortcode into a post, page or sidebar. (See the \”Instructions\” tab in \”Events in Gozo\”)

Installation via ftp:

  1. Download the plugin
  2. Upload the unzippd plugin folder to your WordPress plugin folder (wp-content/plugins)
  3. Go to WordPress and click the Plugins icon on the left menu.
  4. Activate the plugin
  5. Click on \”Events in Gozo\” in the left menu.
  6. In the \”Settings\” tab, enter the username and password provided to you by the Events in Gozo team
  7. Paste the shortcode into a post, page or sidebar. (See the \”Instructions\” tab in \”Events in Gozo\”)
sections.faq:
Where can I obtain fresh authentication credentials for my plugin?

New authentication credentials can be requested via the following link: https://eventsingozo.com/request-api-plugin/

How can I display events on my website?

Events can be showcased on your website using a shortcode. You can insert these shortcodes into a page, post, or widget to display the events. Upon plugin installation, you can configure these shortcodes within a section labeled Instructions.

What display options are available for showcasing events?

Currently, there are three display options for presenting events on your website: minimal list view, grid view, and carousel view.

How do I filter specific events on my website?

Within the shortcode utilized for displaying events, you have the ability to selectively choose categories and/or tags. These attributes, along with others, determine the content displayed on your website.
sections.changelog:
1.0

  • Initial release

1.1

  • New: Added possibility to filter events by locality
  • Improvements: Updated instructions to guide users on how to use the locality filter in the shortcodes
  • Fixed: Fixed how the event time displays when there is no end time

1.2

  • New: Added possibility to show categories in different colors
  • Improvements: Updated instructions to guide users on how to change the way categories are displayed (colored or no color)
  • Improvements: css stylesheets and JS files related to the plugin, are now loaded only on pages where events are displayed
  • Fixed: Fixed issue when event had no image or image too small

1.3

  • Fixed: JS file not being loaded when shortcode was called directly using the do_shortcode() function

1.4

  • New: Added possibility to filter events by organizer
  • Improvements: Loading of css stylesheets and JS files related to the plugin
  • Improvements: Get more events from eventsingozo.com
  • Improvements: Events categories updated
  • Fixed: Events past their end time are now not shown

short_description: Display events happening in Gozo on your own website.

upgrade_notice: Keeping the plugin up to date makes sure that the most stable version is installed and the latest updates and functionality is used from your website.
